info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 5:38PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Chesterfield, west central Henrico, northeastern Dinwiddie, southeastern Amelia and southeastern Powhatan Counties and the City of Richmond through 630 PM EDT... At 538 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Manakin to 7 miles southeast of Moseley to 7 miles southeast of Mannboro. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Rain 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Possible flooding of low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Richmond, Downtown Richmond, Bon Air, Virginia Union University, Virginia Commonwealth University, University Of Richmond, Moseley, Chester, Tuckahoe, Bensley, Bellwood, Matoaca, Lakeside, Sutherland, Chesterfield Court House, Chesterfield, Addison, Ammon, Pocahontas State Park and Skinquarter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in Ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
